revised_title: Observations of the Solar Eclipse and Hydrocarbon Analysis
tldr: This article discusses the observation of the solar eclipse in December 1871 at Sholoor. It also presents a study on the chemical composition of various hydrocarbons, including hexane, dipropyl, heptane, and octane, extracted from petroleum and their comparison with other sources like mannite and castor oil. The author concludes that these hydrocarbons have the same chemical constitution.
